member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Chartsheet.Protect(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Protects the Chartsheet with the specified password.
member.param: The password used to protect the Worksheet.
Optional boolean indicating the new value for the .
Optional boolean indicating the new value for the .

remarks.p: When a Chartsheet is protected without a password, the end user may unprotect the Chartsheet in Excel without having to supply a password. To programatically unprotect a Chartsheet, one may use the method.

The optional parameters are used to update the property values of the instance from this Chartsheet's property. If the parameter is null, the current value of the associated property will be retained; otherwise the property will be updated with the specified value. For example, if the is currently true and the is null, then the property will continue to be true but if the is false the will be changed to false.
Note: If is already true, the method will be ignored.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet
member.summary: Represents one worksheet in a Microsoft Excel workbook.

remarks.p: An Excel worksheet is essentially a table with a limited number of rows and columns. To create new worksheet, use method of the collection on a instance.

The optional parameters are used to update the property values of the instance from this Worksheet's property. If the parameter is null, the current value of the associated property will be retained; otherwise the property will be updated with the specified value. For example, if the is currently true and the is null, then the property will continue to be true but if the is false the will be changed to false.
When one protects a Worksheet in Excel, the UI allows one to choose which cells may be selected. To affect this state one would change the property before or after protecting the Worksheet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.Columns
member.summary: Gets the collection of columns in the worksheet.

remarks.p: The collection of columns is a fixed length collection, with the maximum number of columns in the collection being or , depending on the Workbook.CurrentFormat. Internally, the columns are only created and added to the collection when they are requested.

Note: Iterating the collection will not create all columns. It will only iterate the columns which have already been used. To create and iterate all columns in the worksheet use a For loop, iterating from 0 to one less than the maximum column count, and pass in each index to the collection's indexer.

member.value: The collection of columns in the worksheet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.ConditionalFormats
member.summary: Returns a collection to which conditions can be added to control the visual attributes of a based on user-defined criteria.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.DataTables
member.summary: Gets the collection of data tables in the worksheet.
member.value: The collection of data tables in the worksheet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.DataValidationRules
member.summary: Gets the collection of data validation rules applied to cells in the Worksheet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.DefaultColumnWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the default column width including padding, in 256ths of the '0' digit character width in the workbook's default font.

remarks.p: The default column width is the width of all columns which do not have their width set.
The value assigned must be between 0 and 65535. Invalid values will be automatically adjusted to valid values.
Setting or getting this property is equivalent to calling or using the value of Character256th.

member.value: The default column width including padding, in 256ths of the '0' digit character width in the workbook's default font.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.DefaultRowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the default row height in twips (1/20th of a point).

remarks.p: The default row height is the height of all rows which do not have their height explicitly set to a positive number.

If the assigned value is -1, the default row height will then be calculated based on the default font for the workbook, and subsequently getting this property will return the font-based default row height.

member.exception: The value assigned is outside the value range of -1 and 8192.
member.value: The default row height in twips (1/20th of a point).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.DisplayOptions
member.summary: Gets the object which controls the display of the worksheet.

remarks.p: The display options include any settings which affect the display of the worksheet when viewed in Microsoft Excel. These settings will not affect the printed worksheet or the data stored in the worksheet.

member.value: The object which controls the display of the worksheet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.FilterSettings
member.summary: Exposes methods to identify a region in the worksheet and to apply filters and optionally sort criteria to that region.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.Hyperlinks
member.summary: Gets the collection of hyperlinks applied to cells and regions in the Worksheet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.ImageBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets the background image for the worksheet.

remarks.p: This image is tiled across the background of the worksheet. If null, the worksheet will have no background.

member.value: The background image for the worksheet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.Index
member.summary: Gets the zero-based index of this worksheet in its parent collection.

remarks.p: Negative one indicates the worksheet has been removed from its parent collection.

member.value: The zero-based index of this worksheet in its parent Worksheets collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.MergedCellsRegions
member.summary: Gets the collection of merged cell ranges in this worksheet.

remarks.p: Use method to add new merged cell ranges to the worksheet.

member.value: The collection of merged cell ranges in this worksheet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.PrintOptions
member.summary: Gets the object which controls how the worksheet prints.

remarks.p: The print options include any settings which affect the printed appearance of the worksheet. These settings will not affect the data in the worksheet. Although these are not display settings, some worksheet display styles will display all or some of the print options, so these settings may affect the display of the worksheet when viewed in Microsoft Excel.

member.value: The object which controls how the worksheet prints.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet.Protected

remarks.p: In protected worksheet cells which are locked can not be modified.

member.value: The protection state of Excel worksheet.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.CellFill.CreateRectangularGradientFill(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Creates a rectangular gradient that can be applied to a cell's fill.

remarks.p: The rectangular gradient is defined by specifying an inner rectangle and a set of gradient stops. The gradient goes from the edges of the inner rectangle to the edges of the cell. If the inner rectangle does not have a height or width of 0, the color of the first gradient stop will be filled in the center of the inner rectangle.

The inner rectangle is defined by the , , , and parameters. They are relative values ranging from 0.0 to 1.0 and they go from the top/left to the bottom/right. So, for example, to specify a gradient that goes out from the center, all values would be 0.5. Or to specify a gradient which goes out from the bottom-left corner of the cell, the following values would be used: left = 0.0, top = 1.0, right = 0.0, bottom = 1.0.

member.param: The left edge of the inner rectangle of the gradient, ranging from 0.0 (the left of the cell) to 1.0 (the right of the cell).
The top edge of the inner rectangle of the gradient, ranging from 0.0 (the top of the cell) to 1.0 (the bottom of the cell).
The right edge of the inner rectangle of the gradient, ranging from 0.0 (the left of the cell) to 1.0 (the right of the cell).
The bottom edge of the inner rectangle of the gradient, ranging from 0.0 (the top of the cell) to 1.0 (the bottom of the cell).
The color at the inner rectangle of the gradient.
The color at the outer rectangle (cell edges) of the gradient.
member.exception: , , , or are less than 0.0 or greater than 1.0.
or are empty or system colors or have a non-opaque alpha channel.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorkbookColorTransform.Alpha
member.summary: Defines the value of the alpha channel for the associated instance, expressed as a number between 0 and 1.

remarks.p: Use this property to control the transparency of the associated color.
For example, to make the associated color 50% transparent, assign a value of .5 to this property.
Assigning a value of null to this property implies that the associated color has no specific alpha channel setting, i.e., the associated color is fully opaque.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorkbookColorTransform.LuminanceModulation
member.summary: Defines the luminance modulation for the associated instance, expressed as a fractional number.

remarks.p: Luminance is also referred to as brightness.

This property specifies the amount by which the luminance of the associated base color is increased. For example, a value of .5 yields a 50% reduction in luminance. A value of 1.0 implies no change in luminance. A value greater than 1.0 implies an increase in luminance; for example, a value of 2.0 doubles the luminance.
Assigning a value of null to this property implies that the associated color has no specific luminance modulation.
Luminance modulation is applied by converting the base color from RGB to HSL, then multiplying the luminance channel by the value of this property, then converting back to RGB.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorkbookColorTransform.LuminanceOffset
member.summary: Defines the luminance offset for the associated instance, expressed as a fractional number.

remarks.p: Luminance is also referred to as brightness.
The luminance offset is applied by converting the base color from RGB to HSL, then the value of this property to the luminance channel, then converting back to RGB.
Assigning a value of null to this property implies that the associated color has no specific luminance offset.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorkbookColorTransform.Shade
member.summary: Defines the shading for the associated instance, expressed as a fractional number.

member.summary: Returns or sets the base unit for the axis.

remarks.para: Setting this property has no visible effect if the property for the specified axis is set to 'CategoryScale'. The set value is retained, however, and takes effect when the CategoryType property is set to 'TimeScale'.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Axis.BaseUnitIsAuto
member.summary: True if Excel chooses appropriate base units for the specified category axis. The default value is True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Axis.CategoryType
member.summary: Returns or sets the category axis type.

remarks.p: This property applies only to category axes.
When set to Automatic, the axis will resolve the category type to either CategoryScale or TimeScale, based on the type of the selected data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Axis.Crosses
member.summary: Returns or sets the point on the specified axis where the other axis crosses.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable to a category axis.
Set this property to Custom to specify a data value as a crossing point, using the property to specify that value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Axis.CrossesAt
member.summary: Returns or sets the point on the at which the perpendicular axis intersects it.

remarks.p: For a category axis, this value is interpreted as the value of a data point. For example, on a category axis with a minimum data value of 0 and a maximum of 500, setting this property to 250 causes this axis to appear near the center of the plot area.
For a value axis, this value is interpreted as the one-based number of the category with which this axis should intersect.
Setting this property causes the property to change to 'Custom'.
This property cannot be used on radar charts.
For 3-D charts, this property indicates where the plane defined by the category axes crosses the value axis.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Axis.CrossAxis
member.summary: Returns or sets the with which this axis intersects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.Left
member.summary: The left position of the text area (ignored unless is set to 'Custom').

remarks.p: The value of this property is expressed as a fractional value between 0 and 1 which represents the ratio of the offset to the width of the chart element.

For example, a value of 0 positions the text area as close as possible to the edge of the chart element; a value of 1 positions it as close as possible to the opposite edge. All values in between 0 and 1 represent a scalar which, when applied to the width of the entire chart element, yields the offset.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.Position
member.summary: Determines whether the position of the text area is automatic or custom as specified by the and properties.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.ReadingOrder
member.summary: Determines the reading order

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.Rotation
member.summary: Determines the rotation of the text area, expressed in degrees.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.Text
member.summary: Returns or sets a object which defines the text to be displayed by the associated chart element.

remarks.p: Because mixed font settings are supported for chart element text, a special object is required to customize the text.
For the simple case where all the text has the same formatting, create an instance of the class, specifiying the text as the value of the 'unformattedString' parameter.
To apply font attributes to a given run of text, i.e., a substring within the text, use the method, and set the applicable properties of the instance returned from the GetFont method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.TextDirection
member.summary: Determines the orientation and direction in which text flows.

remarks.p: Note that the property is only applicable when this property is set to Horizontal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.Top
member.summary: The top position of the text area (ignored unless is set to 'Custom').

remarks.p: The value of this property is expressed as a fractional value between 0 and 1 which represents the ratio of the offset to the height of the associated chart element.

For example, a value of 0 positions the title as close as possible to the edge of the associated chart element; a value of 1 positions it as close as possible to the opposite edge. All values in between 0 and 1 represent a scalar which, when applied to the height of the entire chart element, yields the offset.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Determines the vertical alignment of the text area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.VerticalOverflow
member.summary: Determines whether text is allowed to continue vertically outside the bounds of the containing element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.WrapText
member.summary: Determines whether text is wrapped when it would exceed the bounds of the containing element.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.SetFormula(System.String,System.Nullable{Infragistics.Documents.Excel.CellReferenceMode})
member.summary: Assigns a new to this instance.
member.param: The string representation of the formula used to get the .
A value which specifies whether the parameter should be interpreted as an A1 or R1C1 expression. This parameter is optional and defaults to null, in which case the property is used.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartTextAreaBase.GetResolvedFont(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the resolved font to use for consumers that do not support rich text. If the first run has formatting information it is merged with the font returned from this.DefaultFont, otherwise this.DefaultFont is returned.
member.param: True to include the font of the first formatting run. If false is specified only this.DefaultFont is included.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabel
member.summary: Represents the label of a specific .

member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabel.Height
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that represents the height of the label, expressed as a ratio, relative to the size of the chart area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabel.IsDeleted
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether this label has been deleted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabel.LabelPosition
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the label's position as relative to the series bar/line.

remarks.p: When this property is set to Custom, the position is determined by the values of the Left and Top properties.
When a custom label position is assigned, connecting lines appear between the label and its respective . These lines are referred to as 'leader lines'; use the property to control their appearance.
Note that leader lines can be hidden by setting the property to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabel.Position
member.summary: This property is not supported. Use the property instead.

member.summary: Returns or sets if the bubble size is shown. Applies only to which are displayed within a bubble chart.

member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether the category name is shown.

remarks.p: The category name is not shown by default; to show the category name in the label, set this property to true.

member.summary: Returns or sets if the key is shown.

remarks.p: The series name is not shown by default; to show the series name in the label, set this property to true.

member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the data label range is shown.

The data label range is not shown by default; to show the range in the label, set this property to true.

member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether the value is shown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.SeriesDataLabels.DataLabelsRange
member.summary: Returns a which defines the cell range from which part or all of the label text is obtained.

remarks.p: Use the method to assign a new value.
The cell values obtained from this property are only displayed when the property is set to true.
The specified range must contain only one column or one row, or an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.SeriesDataLabels.ParentLabelLayout
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the label positioning for a Treemap chart.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable for Treemap charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.SeriesDataLabels.ShowLeaderLines
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether leader lines are displayed for the data labels associated with this instance.

remarks.p: Leader lines connect data labels to their respective data points.
The property provides a way to customize the appearance of the connecting lines. These lines are only drawn, however, for data labels whose property is set to Custom.

Use this property to allow leader lines to be shown using the default appearance, i.e., setting this property to true without specifying a custom appearance causes them to acquire the default appearance as determined by Excel.
Leader lines can be hidden by setting this property to false.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition
member.summary: Constants which define the location at which a is positioned.

remarks.p: Note that which constants in this enumeration are applicable is dependent on the chart type.
The following table lists the supported constants for each chart type.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.Default
member.summary: The label position is not specified, and is determined automatically by Excel.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.Center
member.summary: The label is centered with respect to the associated data point.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.InsideBase
member.summary: The label's left edge coincides with the left edge of the series bar/line.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.InsideEnd
member.summary: The label's right edge coincides with the right edge of the series bar/line.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.OutsideEnd
member.summary: The label's left edge coincides with the right edge of the series bar/line.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.Custom
member.summary: The label's position is explicitly defined via the and properties.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.Left
member.summary: The label is positioned to the left of the associated data point.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.Right
member.summary: The label is positioned to the right of the associated data point.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.Above
member.summary: The label is positioned above the associated data point.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.Below
member.summary: The label is positioned below the associated data point.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataLabelPosition.BestFit
member.summary: The label is positioned where it best fits with relation to the associated pie slice.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DisplayBlanksAs
member.summary: Constants which define how blank cell values are plotted on the chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DisplayBlanksAs.NotPlotted
member.summary: Points representing blank cell values are not plotted on the chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DisplayBlanksAs.Zero
member.summary: Blank cell values are interpreted as having a value of zero.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DisplayBlanksAs.Interpolated
member.summary: The value is interpolated from adjacent values.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DisplayUnit
member.summary: Constants which determine the unit of expression for value labels.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DisplayUnit.None
member.summary: The raw value is displayed without special formatting.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DisplayUnit.Custom
member.summary: The property determines the display unit.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DisplayUnit.Percentage
T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition
member.summary: Constants which determine whether a chart element is positioned automatically or at a specific location in the chart space.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.Automatic
member.summary: The chart element is positioned automatically as appropriate for that element. For example, a is typically positioned at the top of the chart space, centered horizontally.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.Custom
member.summary: Custom.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.Top
member.summary: The chart element is positioned above the plot area, centered horizontally. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.Left
member.summary: The chart element is positioned to the left of the plot area, centered vertically. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.Right
member.summary: The chart element is positioned to the right of the plot area, centered vertically. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.Bottom
member.summary: The chart element is positioned under the plot area, centered horizontally. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.TopLeft
member.summary: The chart element is positioned above the plot area, horizontally aligned with the left edge. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.TopRight
member.summary: The chart element is positioned above the plot area, horizontally aligned with the right edge. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.BottomLeft
member.summary: The chart element is positioned below the plot area, horizontally aligned with the left edge. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.BottomRight
member.summary: The chart element is positioned below the plot area, horizontally aligned with the right edge. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.LeftTop
member.summary: The chart element is positioned to the left of the plot area, vertically aligned with the top edge. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.LeftBottom
member.summary: The chart element is positioned to the left of the plot area, vertically aligned with the bottom edge. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.RightTop
member.summary: The chart element is positioned to the right of the plot area, vertically aligned with the top edge. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ElementPosition.RightBottom
member.summary: The chart element is positioned to the right of the plot area, vertically aligned with the bottom edge. Applicable only for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, Pareto, Sunburst, Treemap, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.EndStyleCap

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.EndStyleCap.Cap
member.summary: The line terminates with a cap.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.EndStyleCap.NoCap

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorBarDirection

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorBarDirection.Both
member.summary: The error bar extends in both directions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorBarDirection.Plus
member.summary: The error bar extends only in the positive direction.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorBarDirection.Minus
member.summary: The error bar extends only in the negative direction.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorValueType

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorValueType.FixedValue
member.summary: The error range is defined by a fixed numerical value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorValueType.Percentage
member.summary: The error range is defined by a percentage.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorValueType.StandardDeviation
member.summary: The error range is defined by standard deviation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorValueType.StandardError
member.summary: The error range is defined by standard error.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientType
member.summary: Constants which determine the type of gradient applied to a .

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientType.Linear
member.summary: The gradient extends in a linear direction.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientType.Radial
member.summary: The gradient extends along a radial curve.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientType.Rectangular
member.summary: The gradient extends along a rectangular path.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientType.Path
member.summary: The gradient direction is determined by the shape's path.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GridLineType

member.summary: Determines the horizontal alignment for a title

member.summary: The title will be centered horizontally

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.HorizontalTitleAlignment.Distributed
member.summary: The title will be distributed

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.HorizontalTitleAlignment.Justify
member.summary: The title will be justified

member.summary: The title will be aligned on the left

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition
member.summary: Constants which determine the placement of the chart's .

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition.Bottom
member.summary: The legend appears at the bottom of the chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition.Left
member.summary: The legend appears near the left edge of the chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition.Right
member.summary: The legend appears near the right edge of the chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition.Top
member.summary: The legend appears at the top of the chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition.TopRight
member.summary: The legend appears near the top right corner of the chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition.Custom
member.summary: The legend's size and location is determined by the , , , and properties.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition.Default
member.summary: The legend position is determined automatically by Excel.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition.TopLeft
member.summary: The legend appears near the top left corner of the chart. Supported only for Histogram, Pareto, Treemap, Sunburst, Box and Whisker, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition.BottomLeft
member.summary: The legend appears near the bottom left corner of the chart. Supported only for Histogram, Pareto, Treemap, Sunburst, Box and Whisker, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.LegendPosition.BottomRight
member.summary: The legend appears near the bottom right corner of the chart. Supported only for Histogram, Pareto, Treemap, Sunburst, Box and Whisker, and Waterfall chart types.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorBars
member.summary: Represents the error bars on a chart series.

remarks.para: Error bars indicate the degree of uncertainty for chart data. Only series in area, bar, column, line, and scatter groups on a 2-D chart can have error bars. Only series in scatter groups can have x and y error bars. This object isn't a collection. There's no object that represents a single error bar; you either have x error bars or y error bars turned on for all points in a series or you have them turned off.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ErrorBars.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the direction in which the error bars extend from the data points.

member.summary: Returns or sets the end style for the error bars.

member.summary: Determines the width of the line, expressed in points.

member.summary: Returns or sets a value which defines the error range.

remarks.p: The unit for this property is determined by the property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartGradientFill.#ctor(Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientType,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientStop},System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: A constant which defines the type of gradient, i.e., linear, circular, rectangular, etc.
An enumerable list of instances which define the location and color of each transition point in the gradient.
The angle defining the path along which the gradient extends; applies only to linear gradients. This parameter is optional and defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartGradientFill.Angle
member.summary: Returns the angle defining the path along which the gradient extends; applicable only for linear gradients.

remarks.p: This property only applies to linear gradients.
This property defines the angle the gradient path makes with the horizontal plane.
For example, a gradient which extends from left to right can be changed to extend from bottom to top by setting this property to 90 degrees.
A value of 45 degrees yields a gradient which extends from the bottom left corner of the containing element to the top right corner.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartGradientFill.GradientType
member.summary: Defines the style for the gradient.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartGradientFill.GetStops
member.summary: Returns an enumerable list containing each associated with this gradient, ordered by their .
member.returns: An array of instances.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartEmptyFill
member.summary: Placeholder which indicates that no fill should be rendered for the associated chart element.

remarks.p: Some chart elements require an explicit setting to prevent the fill from appearing.
Whether a fill is automatically rendered by Excel is dependent on the chart element.
Use this class to ensure that no fill is rendered for the associated chart element.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartEmptyFill.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientStop
member.summary: Describes the location and color of a transition point in a gradient.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientStop.#ctor(Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorkbookColorInfo,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new instance with the specified color and position.
member.param: A instance which defines the color for this stop.
A value between 0 and 1 which defines the relative position within the fill area up to which this stop is applied.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientStop.Color
member.summary: Returns the color for this gradient stop.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.GradientStop.Position
member.summary: Returns the position of this gradient stop, as a number between 0 and 1.

remarks.p: The value assigned to the Position property represents a fraction of the area to which the gradient is applied.
For example, to add two stops of equal length, create one GradientStop with a position of .5 and another with a position of 1.0.

The first stop extends from the origin to the halfway point of the fill area, and the second extends from the end of the first to the endpoint of the area to be filled. For three uniform stops, use .33. .67, and 1.0 as the respective positions; for four, use .25, .5, .75, and 1.0, etc.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.summary: Determines the appearance of the border drawn around the text area, as well as whether a border appears.

member.summary: Defines the font properties for legend entries which have no specific font settings. Read-only.

remarks.p: To apply font settings to a specific legend entry, use the property.
remarks.para: Note: this property will return null until the is set on the WorksheetChart.Legend property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Legend.DefaultFontFill
member.summary: Returns or sets a derived object which defines the font color(s) for legend entries.

remarks.p: Use this property to apply the same font color(s) to all legend entries.
Use the property to apply font color(s) for a particular legend entry.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Legend.Fill
member.summary: Returns or sets a derived object which defines the fill properties for the legend's text area.

remarks.p: This property returns null by default, indicating that no fill is applied.
To apply a solid color fill, assign an instance of the class to this property.
To apply a gradient fill, assign an instance of the class to this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Legend.FillResolved
member.summary: Returns this.Fill if explicitly set, otherwise returns a ChartEmptyFill instance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Legend.Height
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that represents the height of the legend area, expressed as a fraction of the chart area's height.

remarks.p: Valid values for this property range between zero and one, with a value of one representing the total height of the chart area.
A value of .1 (for example) represents a height that is equal to one-tenth the height of the chart area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Legend.Left
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that represents the position of the left edge of the legend area, expressed as a fraction of the chart area's width.

remarks.p: Valid values for this property range between zero and one, with a value of one representing the total width of the chart area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Legend.LegendEntries
member.summary: Returns a read only collection of legend entries.

remarks.p: This collection contains one entry for each in the associated chart's .
This collection does not include legend entries for trendlines.
Use the property to obtain a reference to the legend entry associated with a trendline.

member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the legend can intersect with the chart's plot area.

member.summary: Returns or sets a value that represents the position of the legend on the chart.

For example, to situate the area such that it's left edge coincides with the center of the containing element, set this property to .5.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.PlotArea.Top
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which represents the top edge of the area, expressed as a fraction of the height of the containing chart element.

remarks.p: This property can be set to a value between zero and one, where one represents the total height of the containing element.
For example, to situate the area such that it's top edge coincides with the center of the containing element, set this property to .5.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.PlotArea.Width
member.summary: Returns or sets the width of the area, expressed as a fraction of the width of the containing chart element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.PlotArea.Position
member.summary: Returns or sets the position of the plot area on the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.PlotArea.FillResolved
member.summary: Returns the value of the Fill property if it is explicitly set, otherwise returns a ChartEmptyFill, resulting in a transparent plot area.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint
member.summary: Represents the a specific data point in a .

remarks.p: This class encapsulates an individual point of data in a .

A data point manifests differently depending on the chart type; for example, on a bar chart it represents the bar itself, and for a line chart, it represents a point on the line. For pie and doughnut charts, a data point represents a slice or wedge in the pie/doughnut.

Many of the properties exposed by this class are also found on the class; setting the property on the series affects all points on the series, whereas setting a property on this class affects only one individual point in the series.
In cases where most of the data points share the same property values, use the property of the Series class, overriding the property values for any individual points using this class.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.ApplyPicToEnd
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether a picture is applied to the end of the point or all points in the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.ApplyPicToFront
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether a picture is applied to the front of the point or all points in the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.ApplyPicToSides
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether a picture is applied to the sides of the point or all points in the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.Border
member.summary: Determines the appearance of the border drawn around the data point's area.

remarks.p: For series which support fills, this property controls the color and size of the line drawn around the data point's fill region.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.DataLabel
member.summary: Returns or sets a instance which defines the properties of the label displayed for this data point.

remarks.p: In order to display data labels, the property must be set to true.
Use the property to apply property settings to all data labels in the series.
Use the property to hide the label for a specific data point.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.Explosion
member.summary: Returns or sets the explosion value for a pie-chart or doughnut-chart slice.

remarks.p: In the context of a pie or doughnut chart, a is synonymous with an individual slice of the pie/doughnut.
Explosion refers to the amount by which a slice in the pie is offset from the center point of the circle.
The valid range of values is between 0 and 400, inclusive.
Use the property to set the explosion for all slices in the pie.

member.exception: The value is outside the range of 0 and 400.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.Fill
member.summary: Returns or sets a derived object which defines the fill properties for the data point.

remarks.p: This property returns null by default, indicating that no fill is applied. In this case, the default fill color for the associated is used.
To apply a solid color fill, assign an instance of the class to this property.
To apply a gradient fill, assign an instance of the class to this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.InvertIfNegative
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether the pattern is inverted in the item when it corresponds to a negative number.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.MarkerBorder
member.summary: Determines the appearance of the border (a.k.a. outline) of the marker for this data point.

remarks.p: This property provides a way to customize the marker border for an individual data point in the series.
A value of null implies that the marker border is not explicitly set on this data point, and should inherit the value from it's associated .
Use the property to customize the border for all markers in the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.MarkerFill
member.summary: Defines the fill appearance of the marker for this data point.

remarks.p: This property provides a way to customize the marker fill color for an individual data point in the series.
A value of null implies that the marker fill color is not explicitly set on this data point, and should inherit the value from it's associated .
Use the property to customize the fill color for all markers in the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.MarkerSize
member.summary: Determines the size of the marker for this data point.

remarks.p: This property provides a way to customize the marker size for an individual data point in the series.
A value of null implies that the marker size is not explicitly set on this data point, and should inherit the value from it's associated .
Use the property to customize the size of all markers in the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.MarkerStyle
member.summary: Determines the style of the marker for this data point.

remarks.p: This property provides a way to customize the marker style for an individual data point in the series.
A value of null implies that the marker style is not explicitly set on this data point, and should inherit the value from it's associated .
Use the property to customize the style of all markers in the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.SetAsTotal
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether this data point represents a total or subtotal in a waterfall chart.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable for waterfall charts.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.DataPoint.GetResolvedFill(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the resolved fill for this DataPoint. If this instance's Fill is explicitly set that value is returned, otherwise an automatically selected contrasting value is returned.
Note that this is used only by pie/doughnut charts for the slice colors, and by scatter charts for the color of the line segments between the points.
member.param: This instance's index in its respective DataPointCollection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Series.AxisGroup
member.summary: Specifies which axis group this series applies to.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable for combo charts.
This property defaults to Primary, causing all series to be plotted on the primary axis unless otherwise specified.
To plot this series on the secondary value axis, set this property to Secondary.
Setting this property to Secondary triggers creation of secondary category and value axes.
Not all series can be plotted on the same axis; the following table lists each ChartType along with the other ChartTypes which can be plotted on the same axis:

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Series.BoxAndWhiskerSettings
member.summary: Returns or sets a instance which determines the properties for a box and whisker chart.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable for box and whisker charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Series.BubbleSizes
member.summary: Returns or sets a instance that determines the bubble sizes in a bubble chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.Series.ChartType
member.summary: Specifies the type of chart for this series. Applicable only for combo charts.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable for combo charts. Setting this property for any other type of chart causes an exception to be thrown.
Not all ChartType values are supported for series which are plotted within a combo chart. For a list of the supported values, see documentation for the WorksheetChart.SetComboChartSourceData method.

If the value assigned to this property necessitates plotting this series on a different axis than the one referenced by the property, and the other axis can accommodate this series, the AxisGroup property is changed accordingly.

If the other axis cannot accommodate this series, and other series which are of the same series type exist on the same axis, an attempt is made to change the ChartType of those other series. For example, if a different series exists with a ChartType of BarClustered, and a value of BarStacked is assigned to this series, the ChartType of the other series is changed to BarStacked in order to accommodate the setting of the property on this series.
If no adjustment can be made that would allow the ChartType to be changed to the specified value, an exception is thrown.
Note that in all cases, the value of the property is automatically changed to a value which is appropriate for the assigned ChartType.

member.exception: The on which this series currently resides cannot share an axis with a series of this ChartType, and no adjustment could be made to avoid this.

member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the type of this series. Applicable only for combo charts.

member.summary: Returns a object that represents the complete chart area for the chart. Read-only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.ChartTitle
member.summary: Returns or sets an object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.ChartType
member.summary: Specifies the chart type.

remarks.p: All chart types are supported by the type; no derived classes exist or are necessary to support different chart types.
Note that changing the chart type may cause related property values to be changed.
For example, when transitioning from a chart type which supports line markers, The property is changed to reflect the new chart style.
Using another example, when transitioning from a chart type which does not support axes, such as a pie or doughnut chart, to a chart type that does support them, the is modified accordingly.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.ComboChartGroups
member.summary: Returns a collection of the instances associated with this chart.

remarks.p: The properties of the class which apply only to a specific chart type are not applicable for combo charts. For example, the property, which applies to bar charts, is not used for bar charts which appear within a combo chart. The reason for this is that combo charts support multiple occurrences of the same chart type, making the WorksheetChart-level properties ambiguous in the context of a combo chart.
This class makes it possible to set chart-specific properties for one or more occurrences of a particular chart type, for a particular axis group.

For example, consider a combo chart with two ClusteredColumn series, one on the primary axis and another on the secondary. To set the property for the chart on the primary axis, add an item to this collection with a of ClusteredColumn, and an of Primary. On the instance returned from the collection's Add method, set the GapWidth property to the desired value.

When the chart is serialized, this collection is checked against each series in the combo chart. If the ChartType and the AxisGroup match the respective properties on a ComboChartGroup instance, the value of that instance's GapWidth property is applied to the chart element for that series. Because the other clustered column series exists on the secondary axis, the property is not applied to that series, since while it has the same ChartType, its AxisGroup is different.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.DepthPercent
member.summary: Returns or sets the depth of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 20 and 2000 percent).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.DisplayBlanksAs
member.summary: Returns or sets the way that blank cells are plotted on a chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.DoughnutHoleSize
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of the hole in a doughnut chart, expressed as a percentage of the size of the encompassing circle.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable to doughnut charts.
The valid range for this property is 0 through 90, inclusive.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.DropLines
member.summary: Returns or sets a instance which determines the appearance for a stock chart's drop lines.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable for stock charts.
High/low lines are not displayed by default; to enable them, assign a to this property. to null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.Floor
member.summary: Returns a object that allows the user to format the bottom wall of a 3-D chart. Read-only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.GapDepth
member.summary: Returns or sets the gap depth in a 3-D chart, expressed as a percentage of the marker width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.GapWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance between the data series in a bar chart, as a percentage of the marker width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.FirstSliceAngle
member.summary: Returns or sets the angle which determines the origin of the first slice, as relative to the 12 o'clock position of the emcompassing circle.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable to pie and doughnut charts.
The valid range for this property is 0 through 360, inclusive. Fractional angles are not supported; nor are negative angles.
By default, the first slice begins at the "12 o'clock" position of the pie chart, i.e., the top center point of the encompassing circle.
Use this property to offset the origin of the first slice; for example, a value of 30 positions the first slice at the 1 o'clock position, 60 at the 2 o'clock position, 90 for 3 o'clock, etc.
Larger values move along the circumference of the emcompassing circle in a clockwise direction, with a value of 0 or 360 both coinciding with the 12 o'clock position.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.HeightPercent
member.summary: Returns or sets the height of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 5 and 500 percent).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.HighLowLines
member.summary: Returns or sets a instance which determines the appearance for a stock chart's high/low lines.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable for stock charts.
High/low lines depict the high and low prices for a stock chart.
High/low lines are displayed by default; to disable them, set this property to null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.Legend
member.summary: Returns or sets a object which represents the legend for the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.Perspective
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that represents the perspective for the 3-D chart view, expressed in degrees.

remarks.p: This property supports values within the inclusive range of 0 and 120.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.PlotArea
member.summary: Returns a PlotArea object that represents the plot area of a chart. Read-only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.PlotVisibleOnly
member.summary: True if only visible cells are plotted. False if both visible and hidden cells are plotted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.RightAngleAxes
member.summary: True if the chart axes are at right angles, independent of chart rotation or elevation. Applies only to 3-D line, column, and bar charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.RotationX
member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation of a 3-D chart view around the X-axis, expressed in degrees.

remarks.p: This property controls the viewing perspective by rotating the chart around the horizontal axis, such that the top of the chart appears to move closer or further away.
This property is only applicable to 3D charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.RotationY
member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation of a 3-D chart view around the Y-axis, expressed in degrees.

remarks.p: This property controls the viewing perspective by rotating the chart around the vertical axis, such that the left edge of the chart appears to move closer or further away.
This property is only applicable to 3D charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.SecondPlotSize
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of the second plot area in a 'bar of pie' or 'pie of pie' chart, expressed as a percentage of the first plot area's size.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable for the BarOfPie and PieOfPie chart types.
This property supports values in the range of 5 to 200, inclusively.

Up/down bars depict gains or losses across a series for a stock chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.VaryColors
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the fill colors for series and data points are automatically selected by Excel.

remarks.p: This property defaults to true, causing fill colors for series and data points to be automatically selected by Excel.
The automatically selected color can always be overridden for individual series and/or data points using the , , and properties.

In cases where VaryColors is set to true, but a fill is explicitly assigned, the assigned fill is used for the associated series or data point, while series or data points which have no explicitly assigned fill will have a fill color automatically selected.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.WallDefault
member.summary: Returns a object which represents the back and side walls, and floor of the chart. Applicable only for 3-D charts.

remarks.p: Use this property to apply the same settings for the back wall, side wall, and floor.
Use the property to control the appearance of the back wall.
Use the property to control the appearance of the side wall.
Use the property to control the appearance of the bottom wall.
The BackWall, SideWall, and Floor properties take precedence over this property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetChart.SetComboChartSourceData(System.String,Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Charts.ChartType[],System.Boolean,System.Nullable{Infragistics.Documents.Excel.CellReferenceMode})
member.summary: Sets the source data range for a combo chart.
member.param: The data range for the combo chart
An array of constants which specify the chart type for each series yielded from the specified .
Optional. True to plot by rows where each row is a separate series or false to plot by columns where each column is a separate series. The default is false.
Optional. Determines how to parse the dataRange.

remarks.p: Combo charts support multiple chart types within the main chart, with each different chart type being associated with one or more .
Use this method to populate the for a combo chart.

For example, given a which yields three series, the caller can specify an array with three elements as the value of the parameter. Each array element is then applied to the corresponding series, in the same order in which they appear in the array.

Duplicate ChartType values can appear in the array, in which case the corresponding series appear within the same chart. For example, specifying an array with ClusteredColumn, Line, and Line results in a combo chart with the first series appearing in a clustered column chart, and the remaining series appearing in a line chart.

Specifying null for the value of the parameter is treated the same as a two-element array containing 'ColumnClustered' and 'Line', resulting in a clustered column chart for the first series, and a line chart for the remaining series.

If fewer values are present in the array than the number of series yielded from the specified , the remaining series acquire the same ChartType and AxisGroup as the last element in the seriesChartTypes array. If more values are present in the array than the number of series yielded, these values are ignored.
Certain chart type values are invalid for a combo chart; if any of these chart types are present in the array, an exception is thrown, listing the invalid chart types.
The following table lists the ChartType values which are supported in combo charts, grouped by series type:

tr.td: ColumnClustered, ColumnStacked, ColumnStacked100, BarClustered, BarStacked, BarStacked100, BarOfPie
Line, LineStacked, LineStacked100, LineMarkers, LineMarkersStacked, LineMarkersStacked100

remarks.p: Combo charts support a maximum of two axis groups. If the combination of values in the array necessitates more than two axis groups, an exception is thrown.
Combo charts require a minimum of two . If the specified yields less that two series, an exception is thrown.

If the combination of series used in a combo chart is indistinguishable from a non-combo chart, the chart may not be recognized by Excel as a combo chart. For example, adding two series, one of type Radar and one of type RadarMarkers, is a valid combination. When opened in Excel, however, such a chart will not be recognized as a combo chart, since the combination of series does not necessitate multiple chart elements. All relevant property values are persisted, however, and there is no distinguishable difference between the original chart and the serialized one.

member.exception: The current value of the property is not Combo.
The specified array contains one or more values which are not supported within a combo chart.
The specified array contains a combination of values which would require more than the maximum allowable number of axes (two).

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.ColorScaleConditionalFormat
member.summary: Exposes properties which control the coloring of a based on the cell's value as relative to minimum, midpoint, and maximum threshold values.

remarks.p: This class support either a 2-color or 3-color scale, as determined by the value of the colorScaleType parameter of the constructor.
For 2-color scales, cells in the associated range are colored based on how their value relates to the minimum and maximum thresholds.
For 3-color scales, cells in the associated range are colored based on how their value relates to the minimum, midpoint, and maximum thresholds.
This class supports a maximum of three separate and distinct color thresholds.
Specifying only one threshold is not supported and may result in unexpected behavior.

If this instance is created as a 2-color scale, the property is not applicable. Attempting to set a property on the object returned from the MidpointThreshold property in this case will cause an exception to be thrown.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.ColorScaleConditionalFormat.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetRegion},Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.ColorScaleType)

member.param: The worksheet regions.
A value which identifies this instance as supporting two or three color scale thresholds. This parameter defaults to 'TwoColor'.

remarks.p: A instance which is created with the 'TwoColor' value does not support the ; attempting to set a property on the object retuned from the MidpointThreshold property will cause an exception to be thrown.

member.summary: Returns a object which defines the properties of the minimum threshold for this instance.

remarks.p: The minimum threshold defines the criteria for the lowest or minimum value across the associated range.
For a 2-color scale, the defines the next "stop"; for a 3-color scale, the property defines the next stop.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.ConditionalFormatCollection
member.summary: Collection class for objects which derive from .

remarks.p: To enable a conditional format on a region of worksheet cells, add a -derived instance to this collection.
This collection exposes an Add method for each type of conditional format available.
For example, to add a conditional format which is based on a value and a logical operator, use the method.

The conditional formatting classes which derive from expose a CellFormat property, which in turn exposes properties which control the visual attributes of cells which meet the criteria defined by the condition. This format is applied to cells with a value which passes the condition.

remarks.p: Each constant in the enumeration contains either 3, 4, or 5 in its name. This number identifies the number of thresholds supported by the condition.
A three-threshold condition supports thresholds of 33%, 67%, and 100%.
A four-threshold condition supports thresholds of 25%, 50%, 75%, and 100%.
A five-threshold condition supports thresholds of 20%, 40%, 60%, 80%, and 100%.
A object for each threshold, is returned from the collection.
These objects provide the ability to customize the values for the corresponding threshold. For example, the icon that is displayed for a given index can be overridden using the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.ConditionBase.Priority
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the order of evaluation when multiple conditional formatting rules exist.

remarks.p: By default, conditions are evaluated in the order in which they appear within the containing collection.
This property makes it possible to weight one condition over another, essentially overriding the condition's ordinal position within the collection.
A lower number means a higher priority; for example, a condition with a priority of 1 is evaluated before one with a priority of 2.
If a cell value meets more than one condition, the format defined by the first condition to be evaluated takes precedence.
Setting the priority on one condition may cause the value of other conditions in the collection to be changed to ensure that each condition has a unique value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.ConditionBase.StopIfTrue
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean indicating whether additional formatting rules are evaluated if this rule evaluates to true. Applicable only in the case where the containing collection contains more than one element.

remarks.p: If a cell value meets more than one condition, the format defined by the first condition takes precedence. Individual format properties are "merged" during the resolution process; for example, if one format has red borders and another has a red foreground color, a cell value which meets both conditions may be formatted with both red borders and a red foreground color.
This property makes it possible to short-circuit the resolution process, so that no other conditional formats are applied after the first condition evaluates to true.

Using the above example, assume StopIfTrue is set to a value of true on the conditional format with red borders, a second conditional format exists with a red foreground color, and a cell value meets both conditions. Because the StopIfTrue setting prevents additional formats from being evaluated, the cell will not show a red foreground color, whereas with StopIfTrue being set to false, it would show both red borders and a red foreground color.
In addition to preventing subsequent conditions from being evaluated, the order in which conditions are evaluated can be controlled using the property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.ConditionBase.MeetsCriteria(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32,Infragistics.Documents.Excel.FormulaUtilities.CalcEngine.RefBase)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns a boolean value indicating whether the specified meets the criteria defined by this instance.
member.param: The cell value to compare.
The index of the row
The index of the column
The reference for the cell.
member.returns: True if the condition is met.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.ConditionBase.SetFirstPriority
member.summary: Sets the value for this rule such that it is the first condition to be evaluated. Applicable only in the case where there is more than one element contained within the associated collection.

remarks.p: When multiple conditions exist in the same collection, the order in which they are evaluated has bearing on which format is applied to cells which meet those conditions.
This method ensures that the associated condition is the first one to be evaluated.
To make a condition the last one to be evaluated, use the method.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.ConditionBase.SetLastPriority
member.summary: Sets the value for this rule such that it is the last condition to be evaluated. Applicable only in the case where there is more than one element contained within the associated .

remarks.p: Just as the method ensures that the associated condition is evalulated first, the SetLastPriority method ensures that the associated condition is evaluated last.
Calling this method on more than one condition essentially replaces the previously designated condition as the last one to be evaluated with this one.

IList of WorksheetRegion instances.
CellReferenceMode (defaults to A1)

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.IconCriterion
member.summary: Defines the criterion for an threshold.

remarks.p: This class provides the ability to override the default behavior of the associated condition for the threshold defined by this instance.
For example, the icon displayed for cell values which fall within this threshold is determined by the value of the , but can be overridden using the property.

Similarly, the default unit for this criterion's value is percentage, but this can be overridden using the property. For example, to define the unit for the value as a specific number, assign a value of Number to the ValueType property.

The value for this threshold is defined by the parent condition, based on the total number of thresholds. For values which yield three thresholds, for example, the effective value is dependent on the threshold, so that each threshold represents approximately 33% of the associated range. This can be overridden using the property; for example, setting the ValueType property to Number and the Value property to a specific number overrides the behavior as defined by the parent condition, and forces the threshold boundary to the specific numeric value.

For this reason, the , , and properties support null values, and are in fact set to null by default; this is interpreted by the parent condition as "not set", resulting in the threshold criterion being determined solely by the parent condition.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.IconSetConditionalFormat
member.summary: Exposes properties which displays icons in a based on the cell's value as relative to threshold values.

remarks.p: This class provides the ability to display an icon inside a cell when that cell's value meets the criteria defined by the relevant .

Each icon set contains between three and five individual icons. The number of icons defines the number of thresholds; for example, a 3-icon set implies 3 thresholds, with each threshold representing approximately 33% of the associated range. A 4-icon set provides 4 thresholds, each representing 25% of the range; a 5-icon set contains 5 thresholds with each representing 20% of the range.
Threshold ranges are pre-defined based on the number of icons in the associated set, although this can be customized using the Value property of the associated with that threshold.

By default thresholds are expressed as percentages; use the Value property to customize this to support a percentile rating or a specific value. How the Value property is interpreted is dependent on the ValueType property.
While the number of thresholds is always fixed at 3, 4, or 5, the icon which is displayed for a given threshold can be customized using the property.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.RankConditionalFormat
member.summary: Exposes properties which control the visual attributes of a based on whether a cell's value is within the top or bottom rank of values across the associated range.

remarks.p: A rank condition evaluates to true if a cell value is within the range defined by the top or bottom n values across the associated range, where n represents the .

A popular example of a rank condition is "top ten ", where cell values which are within the range of the ten highest values across the range meet the condition. The property, however, can be set to any arbitrary number or percentage, and is not limited to only the top or bottom ten values.
By default, this condition evaluates to true if a cell's value is at or above the specified rank; to change this to the bottom of the ranking, set the property to 'Bottom'.
The numeric criteria can be changed to a percentage using the property. In this case, the Rank property is interepreted as a percentage.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.RankConditionalFormat.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Infragistics.Documents.Excel.WorksheetRegion},Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.FormatConditionTopBottom,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance, initializing the value of the property to the specified value.
member.param: The worksheet regions.
A value which determines whether to compare against the highest or lowest values in the range. This parameter is optional and defaults to 'Top'.
The initial value of the property. This parameter is optional and defaults to 10.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.RankConditionalFormat.IsPercent
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the is determined by a percentage value.

remarks.p: By default, this condition evaluates cell values against the value of the property, with the rank representing an explicit numeric value. Set this property to true to identify the rank as a percentage.
If the IsPercent property is set to true, this property supports only values between 1 and 100, inclusively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.RankConditionalFormat.Rank
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which specifies either the number or percentage of the rank value for the associated condition.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is 10, and the default value for the property is 'Top', so that creating an instance of this class without specifying non-default property values results in a "top ten" condition.
The value of this property is interepreted as either a number or a percentage, depending on the value of the property.
If the IsPercent property is set to true, this property supports only values between 1 and 100, inclusively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.ConditionalFormatting.RankConditionalFormat.TopBottom
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether a cell value must fall within the top or bottom of the ranking across the associated range.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.CustomView
member.summary: Represents a custom view in Microsoft Excel.

remarks.p: Custom views provide a way to save display options and optionally print options for the workbook and each worksheet in the workbook. These options can be different from the options currently set on the workbook and worksheets.
Multiple custom views can be saved with a workbook, and the options from a custom view can be applied to its associated workbook by calling the method on it.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.CustomView.Apply
member.summary: Applies all options from the custom view to the associated workbook and its worksheets.

remarks.p: There is no state of the workbook indicating the custom view currently applied, so applying a custom view simply copies over all options saved with it to the workbook and its worksheet. If an applied custom view is then changed, those changes will not be updated on the workbook or worksheets. Instead, the custom view will need to be applied again for those changes to be reflected on the workbook or worksheet.

member.exception: The custom view has previously been removed from its associated workbook.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Excel.CustomView.GetDisplayOptions(Infragistics.Documents.Excel.Worksheet,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the display options associated with the specified worksheet.

remarks.p: Setting properties on the returned instance will not change the actual display of the worksheet. After setting properties, the method of the will apply them to the worksheet.

member.param: The worksheet whose associated display options are to be retrieved.

True to create the display options if it has not yet been allocated. The options will be initialized based on the current state of the Worksheet. Note the options should only have been null if there were no options for the Worksheet when the Workbook was loaded.
member.exception: is null.
member.returns: Null if the worksheet does not belong to the workbook associated with this custom view; otherwise, the display options associated with the worksheet.

member.summary: Gets the display options associated with the specified sheet.

remarks.p: Setting properties on the returned instance will not change the actual display of the sheet. After setting properties, the method of the will apply them to the sheet.

member.param: The sheet whose associated display options are to be retrieved.

True to create the display options if it has not yet been allocated. The options will be initialized based on the current state of the Sheet. Note the options should only have been null if there were no options for the Sheet when the Workbook was loaded.
member.exception: is null.
member.returns: Null if the sheet does not belong to the workbook associated with this custom view; otherwise, the display options associated with the worksheet.

True to create the hidden column if it has not yet been allocated of the Worksheet. The options will be initialized based on the current state. member.summary: Gets or sets the magnification level of the worksheet in the current .

member.summary: Represents the workbook window options which are saved with custom views.

remarks.p: The properties explicitly defined on this class and not inherited from the base class, , are options that can be saved with a custom view, but not with a workbook. Therefore, these properties will not be applied when the method is called.
